Guess that's not the optimal way.

data.title: Disable legacy coordinate hack in TS.
data.body: This should fix #8274.  It could do with some testing by @penev92 or @DoGyAUT to confirm this.

data.title: Add `nunit` NUnit make target to Makefile.
data.body:
This allows for overrides from the `make nunit ...` command line:
- Use NUNIT_CONSOLE if nunit[2]-console is not in bin search paths
- Use NUNIT_LIBS_PATH if NUnit libs are not in search paths. Include trailing /
- Use NUNIT_LIBS if NUnit libs have different names (such as including a prefix or suffix)

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8849.

data.title: Align the footprint tiles with the building preview.
data.body: This fixes the misaligned building placement tiles when the building is moved over sloped terrain.

data.title: Fix WPos <-> CPos conversions.
data.body:
Fixes #6247 / Closes #8463 once and for all - #7748 just moved the bug.

Includes a testcase commit that should be removed prior to merging.  Use the terrain grid visualisation to compare the current mouse world coordinate with the center of the current cell (only works for flat cells).

data.title: Sync members of base classes
data.body:
The method that generates sync hashing functions for traits was missing out non-public members in base classes of that trait. This meant the hash function might not be syncing over all the members you had tagged.

Now, if a trait has a base class with syncable members, we ensure these are included when hashing the state of the trait. This is verified by a test.

I also include a test to guard against unintended changes of the output from the sync mechanism in the future.

data.title: Tall buildings: Cannot repair or sell building above
data.body:
There seems to be an issue with tall buildings (Tesla Coil, Advanced Guard Tower, Allied AA Gun, etc.). I didn't manage to repair or sell a building that I placed directly above it. These tall defense buildings seem to have a larger "selectbox" or whatever. Also I cannot order units to position above them.
I wonder why I couldn't find a ticket already addressing this issue.
Version: current master branch

data.title: Fix WithProductionDoorOverlay namespace
data.body: The file is located in Mods.Common (since it's used by multiple mods), but the namespace didn't reflect that.

data.title: Trees and rocks show white on the radar
data.body: These should use a terrain color or not show on the radar at all.

data.title: Expose the WorldActor to Lua via Map.WorldActor.
data.body: The only testcase for this I have is [ra2#weather2](https://github.com/Phrohdoh/OpenRA/commit/ee52c3b7c90d46ca10810b539812b27324246f53), but eventually it could be used to query (certain?) `GlobalLightingPaletteEffect`s to determine time of day, or other things.

Happened when an e1 was shooting at a target and I had medium tanks moving towards the enemies base. Might have been about to crush it and it crashed the game.

data.title: Some more renaming from "race" to "faction"
data.body:
Yet another piece of #7873.
Split into nice small commits for easy reviewing.

data.title: Unite mod DLLs?
data.body:
This was suggested by @chrisforbes and is something that has crossed my mind a few times before.

Currently there is little code in each of the mod DLLs, and a ton of code in `Common`. The difference for `Common` would be negligible, but this would make the "Can this mod/map use trait X that is from mod Y?" issues a lot better.

> [23:23:58]< chrisf> things that turn out to be useful will move into common code and slowly get more general
> [23:24:17]  < Phrohdoh> certainly, but where do we draw the line?
> [23:24:40]  < chrisf> im not sold on there _being_ a line for things like traits.
> [23:24:50]  < Phrohdoh> Then we should just have a mods.dll
> [23:24:52]  < chrisf> if you have some weird ui junk, sure, keep that in your own dll 

I know we've talked about splitting `Common` to "graphics stuff" vs "logic", or "sprite stuff" vs "voxel stuff" or whatever. Maybe we can dump all the stuff in `Common` first. Then have `Activities.dll`, `Traits.dll`, `Traits.Render.dll`, etc. or whatever we name them.

At this point I am not sure how much point there is to have per-mod DLLs (custom mods of course will add their own logic in their own DLLs) for the official mods, considering how little code they actually contain.

Opening this for discussion. I particularly want to hear what @reaperrr and @GraionDilach think about this, as people with their own mods, because I think this will affect them. Of course we need opinions from the other people interested/involved/capable on commenting on the project's architecture.

(I'm not going to label this issue for now because it's a `Question` that I hope will quickly move to an `Idea` about a `Refactor`.)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25195875-unite-mod-dlls?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Completely replace OpenRA.Test with OpenRA.Utility.exe or Support It
data.body:
It seems that `OpenRA.Test` does not provide much functionality and I have issues with running it on my system:
`dmcs -t:library -out:OpenRA.Test.dll OpenRA.Test/OpenRA.Game/*.cs -r:mods/common/OpenRA.Mods.Common.dll -r:OpenRA.Game.exe -r:nunit.framework.dll -r:System.dll -r:System.Core.dll -r:System.Data.dll -r:System.Data.DataSetExtensions.dll -r:System.Drawing.dll -r:System.Xml.dll -r:thirdparty/download/ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.dll -r:thirdparty/download/FuzzyLogicLibrary.dll -r:thirdparty/download/Mono.Nat.dll -r:thirdparty/download/MaxMind.Db.dll -r:thirdparty/download/MaxMind.GeoIP2.dll -r:thirdparty/download/Eluant.dll && nunit-console OpenRA.Test.dll`
results in:

```
OpenRA.Test/OpenRA.Game/ActorInfoTest.cs(67,9): warning CS0219: The variable `i' is assigned but its value is never used
OpenRA.Test/OpenRA.Game/ActorInfoTest.cs(88,9): warning CS0219: The variable `i' is assigned but its value is never used
Compilation succeeded - 2 warning(s)
NUnit version 2.4.8
Copyright (C) 2002-2007 Charlie Poole.
Copyright (C) 2002-2004 James W. Newkirk, Michael C. Two, Alexei A. Vorontsov.
Copyright (C) 2000-2002 Philip Craig.
All Rights Reserved.

Runtime Environment - 
   OS Version: Unix 4.1.3.2
  CLR Version: 4.0.30319.17020 ( 4.0.2 (Stable 4.0.2.5/c99aa0c Mon Jul 13 18:57:35 UTC 2015) )

Symbol file /tmp/nunit20/ShadowCopyCache/8873_635738788612624820/Tests/assembly/shadow/0f6609dd/157c8393_1a1a8a4e_00000001/OpenRA.Test.dll.mdb doesn't match image (null)

Tests run: 0, Failures: 0, Not run: 0, Time: 0.014 seconds


```

That probably is something with my system, but it is another possible dependency / point of failure.

data.title: Split Requires<> into Requires<> and InitializeAfter<>

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Requires<> - Trait needs other trait
InitializeAfter<> - Trait constructed after other trait.

data.title: Heightmap-aware map helper functions.
data.body:
This finishes the long series of prs that adds heightmap support to the core engine.  Closes #3363.

This includes a commit that adds edge spawning to TS to verify that the edge spawning works there. It should be removed before this is merged!

data.title: Replay files should be compressed
data.body:
The file size exceeds 10 MB for long games. I could compress a 13 MB replay file down to 1.5 MB using normal zip compression.

data.title: Removes spacing between dropdown menu items.
data.body:
Fixes #8829. Adds a new TopBottomSpacing variable that controls the padding at the top and the bottom of the list. ItemSpacing is now added only between two menu items and not at the beginning and at the end of a list. So it is arranged like this:

**TopBottomSpacing**
Menu Item 1
**ItemSpacing**
Menu Item 2
**ItemSpacing**
Menu Item 3
**TopBottomSpacing**
